critique: The document revokes two executive orders related to the blocking of Kuwaiti government property and prohibiting transactions with Kuwait following the expulsion of Iraqi forces. It emphasizes the restoration of Kuwait and its government. The document also clarifies that the revocation does not affect the national emergency declared in Executive Order No. 12722 concerning the threat posed by the Government of Iraq, nor does it affect pending actions or rights and duties that matured prior to the order's effective date.
